title: Noonan and the News From Appomattox
sub_head: Magnanimity in victory and grace in defeat, or is that missing the point?
body:
Regarding Peggy Noonan’s “America’s Most Tumultuous Holy Week” (Declarations, April 16): I was touched by the respect shown by Union officers as they stood in unison and saluted Gen. Robert E. Lee at Appomattox. I was touched also by Lee’s message to his troops: “Leave the result to God. Go to your homes and resume your occupations. Obey the laws and become as good citizens as you were soldiers.”
The magnanimity in victory displayed by President Abraham Lincoln and Gen. Ulysses S. Grant, and the conciliatory attitude adopted by Lee, are a testament to the three men’s character and love of country. At the most divisive time in our history, their thought was how to heal the nation’s wounds.
